>Well, "test everything that could possibly break" is a well-known, time-
>honored, trusted maxim of XP. It was designed to deal with the fact that
"you 
>can't test every case". That said, you should dislike it until you don't 
>dislike it anymore. Keep doing what you're doing.

I believe we've shown that these methods certainly can (and do) break, and
so, IMHO, should be tested.

-tim
